title: What makes good content? How do you know if a piece of content is doing well? - Quora

response.answer_text: Content is a long-term game. The instant measuring metrics can only give you an indication if its received well depending on the content-type but the complete picture will only form in long-term. Here are the most important content metrics to measure your content performance: 1) Pageviews 2) Unique visitors 3) Returning visitors 4) Social shares 5) Avg time spent 6) Pages viewed per session 7) No of backlinks from external sources 8) Number of comments 9) Search engine ranking for targeted keyword Listed above are the basic metrics for every content type but depending on your content type, there can be additional metrics to determine your content performance. For example, for gated content like ebooks, whitepapers, and webinars, your focus should be on the no of email subscriptions, number of conversions, etc. It’s very important to set your content goals beforehand and track the right metrics so that you can gauge how your content is performing. For example, if your focus is on brand awareness then you can’t be judging your content based on page views alone.

From a video stand point like YouTube one of the key performance indicators is audience retention. How long are they watching the video and where do they drop off. When you start out making video content you have to work really hard to push through challenges to get to the other side where you have a good sized subscriber base and good retention stats.
